titleproper.value:
Guide to the Rudolph Valuch Photograph Collection
                    <num>ALBA.PHOTO.142</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Processed by: Evan Daniel, 2004

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T14:22-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Rudolph (Rudy) Valuch (1916[?]- ) was an apprentice tool and die maker affiliated with the Internatinal Association of Machinists. Valuch was attached to the 15th Transport Regiment of the International Brigades during the Spanish Civil War. The collection consists of photographic prints of the 15th Transport Regiment in Spain from April 1937 to September 1938 and contains group photographs and portraits of members of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, Spanish troops, various military vehicles—motorcycles, tanks, trucks, planes—and street scenes.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

Valuch procured the majority of the images from the photographer Charles L. Kaufman. When the collection was donated to ALBA, Valuch provided a numbered inventory with captions that corresponded to 28 of the 111 prints. The collection is arranged in one series, alphabetically by topic. All of the photographs were taken in Spain.

The photographic prints contain four numbers separated by colons. The first number refers to the collection number, the second to the box number, the third to the folder number, and the fourth to the individual print. For example, the first print in this collection is labeled 142:1:1:1.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Abraham Lincoln Battalion.
